bibl.note: Copy of a letter wherein John C. Calhoun, Secretary of War, writes to Reverend Samuel Worcester, Corresponding Secretary of the American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions and missionary to the Cherokees, about an enclosed letter pertaining to the views of President Monroe, September 3, 1819. The enclosed letter appears in the Southeastern Native American Documents Database as ch042

div1.head:
F.
Note from the Secretary of War to Rev. Samuel Worcester Cor. Secy. covering a communication from the President of the United States on the subject of schools c. among the Indians.
div1.p: Believing that the society of which you are the corresponding Secretary, takes an interest in the subject to which the enclosed paper, See paper marked G. containing the views of the President, relates, I have taken the liberty to transmit it to you for the information of the Society.
div1.closer:
I am very respectfully Your Obedt. Servt. (Signed)
J. C. Calhoun
Rev. Samuel Worcester, Correspondg Secy of the Amer. Board of Commissioners for Forn. Missions.
